text: so the next thing of living in space is
you know that million dollar question
how do you use the bathroom in space and
miles said it sucks and it's very
delicate thing to do you don't want to
rush when you're using the bathroom my
first flight you know you kind of sit
down I'll show you we have a different
toilet than we do from the station okay
are our toilet looks more like a real
toilet they've got something that looks
like something from the stone Age's but
when you train to use the toilet on the
ground they actually have a video camera
in the bottom of the toilet so because
you know you've got to be lined up just
right or you're gonna be cleaning lots
of things if you don't want to be
cleaning so so you know if you can hit
the crosshairs you have a little monitor
sitting right in front of you you want
to make sure you hit the crosshair so I
mean but this is all living in space
it's very important you got to got to be
perfect at it you know so you don't want
things you know floating around so so
the toilet on the shuttle side it's
conventional we have things that hold
our legs down we have stirrups and so
forth but on the other hand
Sandi's toilet next line we had this is
a Russian design it's very simple but
it's actually easy to use you do worry
the first time you use the restroom how
well is it gonna work because that's not
really as a rookie how you want to start
your mission no you know what it works
really simply it's a really simple
concept I mean when the engineers had to
figure out how to make a toilet so the
whole idea was make things go away from
you so they came up with air flow is a
good substitute for gravity and so you
turn on a switch it starts some airflow
through the funnel and through the hose
and you can urinate right into the
funnel and the urine gets captured into
some tanks and on board now we have the
ability to recycle urine and recycle
condensate or bad water and make it
potable so we're closing our
life-support system so that's all
self-contained which is what we need to
do to continue our exploration away from
the earth and so it works pretty well we
have a toilet seat that we sit on and
you know on the shuttle Leland mentioned
there's some some straps that can hold
you down this is a small enough
compartment that I could put
one hand on the ceiling and hold myself
on to the onto the toilet it works fine
it's simple which is good if the toilet
breaks down it stops all work on the
space station because everybody on the
ground is now focused on getting the
toilet running again so you need a
toilet that's highly reliable
